segment.source: Tabs on the SUA Tool Interface (Windows 10)
segment.target: Tabs on the SUA Tool Interface (Windows 10)

segment.source: The tabs in the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool show the User Account Control (UAC) issues for the applications that you analyze.
segment.target: The tabs in the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool show the User Account Control (UAC) issues for the applications that you analyze.

segment.source: Tabs on the SUA Tool Interface
segment.target: Tabs on the SUA Tool Interface

segment.source: The tabs in the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool show the User Account Control (UAC) issues for the applications that you analyze.
segment.target: The tabs in the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool show the User Account Control (UAC) issues for the applications that you analyze.

segment.source: The following table provides a description of each tab on the user interface for the SUA tool.
segment.target: The following table provides a description of each tab on the user interface for the SUA tool.

segment.source: Provides the following information for the selected application:
segment.target: Provides the following information for the selected application:

segment.source: Error, warning, and informational messages (if they are enabled)
segment.target: Error, warning, and informational messages (if they are enabled)

segment.source: Provides information about access to the file system.
segment.target: Provides information about access to the file system.

segment.source: For example, this tab might show an attempt to write to a file that only administrators can typically access.
segment.target: For example, this tab might show an attempt to write to a file that only administrators can typically access.

segment.source: Provides information about access to the system registry.
segment.target: Provides information about access to the system registry.

segment.source: For example, this tab might show an attempt to write to a registry key that only administrators can typically access.
segment.target: For example, this tab might show an attempt to write to a registry key that only administrators can typically access.

segment.source: Provides information about WriteProfile API issues.
segment.target: Provides information about WriteProfile API issues.

segment.source: For example, in the Calculator tool (Calc.exe) in Windows® XP, when you change the view from Standard to Scientific, Calc.exe calls the WriteProfile API to write to the Windows\Win.ini file.
segment.target: For example, in the Calculator tool (Calc.exe) in Windows® XP, when you change the view from Standard to Scientific, Calc.exe calls the WriteProfile API to write to the Windows\Win.ini file.

segment.source: The Win.ini file is writable only for administrators.
segment.target: The Win.ini file is writable only for administrators.

segment.source: For example, this tab might show an explicit check for the Builtin\Administrators security identifier (SID) in the user's access token.
segment.target: For example, this tab might show an explicit check for the Builtin\Administrators security identifier (SID) in the user's access token.

segment.source: This operation may not work for a standard user.
segment.target: This operation may not work for a standard user.

segment.source: For example, this tab might show an attempt to explicitly enable permissions that do not work for a standard user.
segment.target: For example, this tab might show an attempt to explicitly enable permissions that do not work for a standard user.

segment.source: Provides information about creation of system objects.
segment.target: Provides information about creation of system objects.

segment.source: For example, this tab might show an attempt to create a new system object, such as an event or a memory map, in a restricted namespace.
segment.target: For example, this tab might show an attempt to create a new system object, such as an event or a memory map, in a restricted namespace.

segment.source: Applications that attempt this kind of operation do not function for a standard user.
segment.target: Applications that attempt this kind of operation do not function for a standard user.

segment.source: Provides information related to applications accessing objects other than files and registry keys.
segment.target: Provides information related to applications accessing objects other than files and registry keys.

segment.source: For example, this tab might show the use of the CreateProcess API to open an executable (.exe) file that, in turn, requires process elevation that will not function for a standard user.
segment.target: For example, this tab might show the use of the CreateProcess API to open an executable (.exe) file that, in turn, requires process elevation that will not function for a standard user.
